segments.text: I notice the woman in her apron, so calmly drying dishes by the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the faucet is filling up and spilling out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's creating this mess on the floor, and she's stepping in it unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me think how easily things can go wrong in a busy home.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there's the boy on the stool, reaching into the open cabinet for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are spread out unevenly, looking ready to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If he falls, it could be really painful for the little guy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is all excited, palm up for her cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're being sneaky, thinking the adult won't catch them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden view outside is serene, almost mocking the indoor trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the mom; she's missing all these hazards.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This could end in tears for everyone involved.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why does life have to throw these little disasters our way?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes stacked nearby might get knocked over too.
segments.speaker: PAR
